contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album<!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Drunken Lullabies | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Flogging Molly]] | Cover = Flogging Molly-Drunken Lullabies.jpg | Released = March 19, 2002 | Recorded = 2001 | Genre = [[Celtic punk]] | Length = 45:18 | Label = [[SideOneDummy Records|SideOneDummy]] | Producer = [[Flogging Molly]], [[Ted Hutt]] | Last album = ''[[Swagger (Flogging Molly album)|Swagger]]''<br />(2000) | This album = '''''Drunken Lullabies'''''<br />(2002) | Next album = ''[[Within a Mile of Home]]''<br />(2004) }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1score = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref>{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r573447|pure_url=yes}}|title=Drunken Lullabies - Flogging Molly|publisher=[[Allmusic]]}}</reF> |rev2 = [[Punknews.org]] |rev2score = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref>http://www.punknews.org/review/849</ref> }} '''''Drunken Lullabies''''' is a 2002 [[album]] by the [[Ireland|Irish]]-[[United States|American]] [[Punk rock|punk]] band [[Flogging Molly]]. It reached # 157 on the Billboard charts. It has since been certified Gold by the RIAA. ==Reception== [[Allmusic]] gave the album a positive review. The review called the title track a standout and noted its themes of "decrying the ills of modern society" as well as its "breakneck speed." It also referred to the song "Death Valley Queen" as a "dirge of Dylanesque proportions." The reviewer concluded that "After one listen, you'll probably wish you were Irish." In a 4-star review, [[Punknews.org]] said that Flogging Molly "sounds authentic" and named “What’s Left Of The Flag," “Rebels Of The Sacred Heart” and “The Rare Ould Times” as the standout tracks. ==In media== *"Drunken Lullabies" is on the tracklisting of the video game ''[[Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 4]]''; it also appeared on the ''[[Rock Against Bush Vol. 2]]'' compilation. *"Rebels of the Sacred Heart" appears on the ''[[Warped Tour 2001 Tour Compilation]]'' *"What's Left Of The Flag" appears on the ''[[Warped Tour 2002 Tour Compilation|Warped Tour 2002 Compilation]]''. *"If I Ever Leave This World Alive" played over the closing credits of the movie ''[[P.S. I Love You (film)|P.S. I Love You]]'', was featured in an episode of ''[[Weeds (TV series)|Weeds]]'', "Lude Awakening" and the ending scene of "Scar Tissue" from season two of ''[[The Shield]]''. ==Track listing== # "Drunken Lullabies" – 3:50 # "What's Left of the Flag" – 3:39 # "May the Living Be Dead (In Our Wake)" – 3:50 # "If I Ever Leave This World Alive" – 3:21 # "The Kilburn High Road" – 3:43 # "Rebels of the Sacred Heart" – 5:11 # "Swagger" – 2:05 # "Cruel Mistress" – 2:57 # "Death Valley Queen" – 4:18 # "Another Bag of Bricks" – 3:45 # "The Rare Ould Times" – 4:06 # "The Son Never Shines (On Closed Doors)" – 4:24 ==Personnel== *Dave King - lead vocals, acoustic guitar, bodhran, banjo, spoons, backing vocals *Bridget Regan - fiddle, tin whistle, ullieann pipes, backing vocals *Dennis Casey - electric guitar, backing vocals *Matt Hensley - accordion *Nathen Maxwell - bass, backing vocals, lead vocals on "Cruel Mistress" *Bob Schmidt - mandolin, banjo, bouzouki, backing vocals *George Schwindt - drums ==Chart performance== {| class="wikitable" !
